intro: Pimelea octophylla subsp. subvillifera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved snowbush, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in dense clusters. The leaves are narrow and covered in fine, soft hairs, giving the plant a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in heathlands and rocky soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade. This subspecies is often found in coastal and inland regions of Western Australia.
